title.narrative: 3.3 WAS-ADOLESCENTS AGENTS OF CHANGE

description.narrative: 103/003 By 2020, the Government and stakeholders in the Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) sector, at national and subnational level, have increased capacity to expand and deliver a package of quality services for adolescent boys and girls, aged 10 to under 18, in emergency and non-emergency situations, and urban settings., which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2020, adolescent girls and boys in Bangladesh, especially the most disadvantaged, access and utilize high-quality basic social services in a safe and protected environment, and are resilient and empowered as active agents of change.

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: 103/003 By 2020, the Government and stakeholders in the WASH sector, at national and subnational level, have increased capacity toexpand and deliver a package of quality services for adolescent boys and girls, aged 10 to under 18, in emergency and non-emergencysituations, and urban settings.

description.narrative: 44,000 adolescents including 29,000 girls;in 110 secondary schools were;educated on;hand hygiene,;menstrual hygiene management (MHM),;safe water handling, safe sanitation practices through;three-star approach;to achieve a healthy and hygienic institutional environment. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
